Are hints available?

Can I play NYT Connections for free?

What skills does the game improve?





The New York Times’ Connections has quickly become a favourite among word puzzle enthusiasts, blending the addictive simplicity of Wordle with more complex challenges in logic and pattern recognition. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups. Success depends on identifying subtle connections, associations, and clever wordplay, making the game both fun and mentally stimulating. For puzzle lovers looking to test their skills, the December 03, 2025 edition (game #906) offers an ideal mix of challenge and insight, encouraging lateral thinking, careful observation, and strategic reasoning. Connections continues to captivate a global audience as a daily exercise in cognitive skill and mental agility.NYT Connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Unlike standard word games, players must detect subtle links between words, which can range from obvious to highly nuanced or abstract. The game is freely available on mobile devices and desktop platforms, allowing enthusiasts to play anytime, anywhere, at their convenience.Its combination of easy-to-understand mechanics, challenging puzzles, and complex problem-solving has turned it into a daily ritual for many. The game’s structure encourages players to sharpen their pattern recognition, develop strategic thinking, improve memory retention, and enjoy a mental workout while having fun.To assist players without giving away the answers directly, here are strategic hints for December 03, 2025:These hints guide players toward recognising patterns, encouraging logical deduction and strategic grouping without removing the challenge entirely.For game #906, the four categories are specifically:Success in the game depends on carefully observing wordplay, spotting subtle connections, and applying strategic reasoning to find the correct groupingsFor those ready to review their solutions or learn from the puzzle logic, the complete answers for game #906 are:Connections continues to captivate players worldwide, turning each puzzle into a thrilling hunt for hidden patterns, where every correct grouping sparks a moment of “aha!” and keeps the mind sharp for the next challenge.Words are presented in a 4x4 grid. Identify patterns or associations to sort them into four correct categories.Yes, the game provides subtle hints to guide players without revealing the answers outright.Yes, it is available for free on both mobile devices and desktop platforms.It sharpens pattern recognition, logical thinking, lateral reasoning, and problem-solving skills.
Article Summary: Nyt connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups.

Article Title: How to clear Gmail storage and keep your inbox running smoothly
Article Text:
Why does Gmail storage fill up faster than expected

How to clear Gmail storage quickly and effectively

Empty the Trash and Spam folders

Delete large emails and attachments

Remove newsletters and old promotional emails

Use the Google One Storage Manager to clear space across all services

Habits that prevent Gmail from filling up again

When you might need more storage

Also read|





Running out of storage on Gmail can be stressful, especially when important emails start bouncing back or the service becomes slow. Many people do not realise how quickly storage fills up across connected Google services like Drive and Photos. Since Gmail shares its storage with the rest of the Google account, everything from attachments to uploaded files contributes to the limit. When the warning appears that storage is almost full, it can feel overwhelming. Fortunately, there are simple and practical steps that help clear space without spending money on upgrades. With a little organisation and a few smart habits, it is possible to reduce clutter and regain smooth performance in your inbox.Google provides an official Storage Manager that helps users see exactly what is taking up space across Gmail, Drive and Photos. The tool highlights large files, old emails with attachments and unnecessary items that can be deleted safely. It is the most reliable method since it works directly with data stored in the cloud rather than guessing what to remove.Gmail storage includes emails, sent items, drafts, attachments and everything stored in Google Drive and Google Photos. Even if the inbox does not appear full, large attachments or uploaded videos may be using most of the space.Promotional emails, newsletters, archived messages and old backups also count towards the total. Deleted items continue to occupy storage until they are permanently removed from Trash, which is why simply deleting emails does not always free space. When storage reaches its limit, Gmail stops receiving new mail and certain functions may not work correctly. Understanding what contributes to the total makes it easier to clean up effectively.When emails are deleted, they move to the Trash folder and stay there for up to 30 days before automatically disappearing. However, they still count towards your total storage until the Trash is emptied manually. The same rule applies to the Spam folder as well. By opening each folder and choosing the option to permanently delete all items together, users can often free up a surprising amount of valuable storage space almost instantly.Attachments are usually the biggest contributors to storage use. Gmail provides search filters that help locate bulky messages. Searching for terms like has: attachment larger:10M displays emails with attachments larger than 10 megabytes. Once these are found, they can be deleted in bulk or downloaded elsewhere before deletion.Promotional categories often accumulate thousands of unread messages because newsletters, offers and automated campaigns pile up quickly without being noticed. These can be selected and removed together to clear storage space and improve inbox performance. If many emails come from the same sender, unsubscribing prevents future build-up and keeps incoming mail manageable by stopping unnecessary notifications permanently. Over time, this simple clean-up habit reduces digital clutter, improves focus and makes it easier to find important conversations without endless scrolling or searching.The Google One Storage Manager scans all the services linked to a Google account and lists files that consume the most space. It separates storage usage into sections such as large emails, deleted items, large files in Drive and backed-up photos or videos. This approach ensures that nothing is missed, especially when files outside Gmail are the primary cause of reduced space. Through a single interface, large items can be reviewed and removed safely without confusion.Regular maintenance avoids repeat storage problems. Clearing old attachments, emptying Trash frequently and reviewing large items every few months helps maintain free space. Avoiding the habit of emailing large files repeatedly can also help. Instead of attaching high-resolution photos and videos directly to emails, it is better to share links from Drive or alternative storage platforms. This allows senders to delete the original attachments without losing access to the files. Unsubscribing from mass mailing lists also helps maintain a clean inbox.For users dealing with intensive file exchange, such as designers, editors, photographers and students, the default free storage may not be enough. In such cases, upgrading to a paid Google One plan is a practical solution. Using two Google accounts is also an option, allowing heavier tasks to be separated from regular daily email.Clearing Gmail storage does not need to be complicated. With a structured approach and support from the official Google tools, anyone can free space quickly and enjoy uninterrupted messaging. Reducing unnecessary files keeps email performance fast, improves organisation and helps stay focused without clutter.A few minutes of clean up can restore full functionality and avoid the frustration of running out of space at the wrong moment. The best approach combines one-time clean-up with regular habits that prevent build-up in the future, keeping Gmail efficient and reliable.
Article Summary: Gmail storage can fill up quickly, especially if large files are attached. Gmail storage includes emails, sent items, drafts, attachments and everything stored in google drive and google photos. Deleted items continue to occupy storage until they are permanently removed from trash.

Article Title: Red Dead Redemption is now available on mobile: System requirements and how to play on Android and iOS
Article Text:
What the Red Dead Redemption mobile release includes

Red Dead Redemption mobile requirements for Android and iOS

Android

iPhone and iPad

How to play Red Dead Redemption on mobile





Red Dead Redemption has officially arrived on mobile for the first time, bringing one of gaming’s most iconic western adventures to smartphones and tablets. Players can now experience the full single-player story, explore the vast open world, and play the Undead Nightmare expansion directly on Android phones, iPhones, and iPads. The release makes the title more accessible to a much wider audience who may not own consoles or gaming PCs. The game now supports touchscreen controls and can be downloaded through mobile app stores or accessed through certain subscription-based platforms. This marks a major moment for fans who have long hoped to explore the Wild West storyline from their pocket.The mobile version includes the full original game, complete story missions, side quests, open world exploration, and the complete Undead Nightmare expansion. Controls have been redesigned for touchscreen play, allowing movement, aiming, and interaction without a physical controller.There are two ways to access the game on mobile:• Buy it directly through the Google Play Store or the Apple App Store• Download it through a supported gaming subscription if eligibleTo play smoothly, your device should meet these specifications:• Android 14 or newer• Minimum 4 GB RAM• 64-bit processor and Vulkan-supported GPU• iOS 18 or newer• At least 3 GB RAM• Sufficient free storage space for the multi-gigabyte installationStorage space and hardware capability will determine performance, so older devices may require lowered graphics settings.• Install from the official app store or through a compatible subscription service• Adjust graphics and frame rate settings based on device performance• Use headphones for fully immersive audio• Enable cloud saves if available for secure progress• Connect a Bluetooth controller if preferred after learning touch controlsThe mobile launch allows millions of players to enjoy console-quality storytelling on a portable device. It makes the title more inclusive and reachable for those without high-end gaming hardware. For long-time fans, it offers the flexibility to play anywhere. For newcomers, it provides a chance to discover a critically praised narrative experience that shaped modern open-world gaming.If you enjoy cinematic storytelling, exploration, and action set in the American frontier, this mobile release is an ideal way to experience it without needing a console.
Article Summary: Red dead redemption is now available on android phones, iphones, and ipads. The mobile version includes the full original game, complete story missions, side quests, open world exploration, and the complete undead nightmare expansion. The game now supports touchscreen controls and can be downloaded through mobile app stores or accessed through certain subscription-based platforms.

Article Title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for December 4, 2025
Article Text:
file photo

BofA Securities has a neutral rating on PB Fintech (Policybazar) with the target price of Rs 1,980. Analysts said that the company’s management sees no GST-led negative impact on health and term policies, some impact on savings business but they’re working to address the same in the next 3-6 months. Most insurer contracts on combined operating ratio. They said that with lower operating expense and better claims ratio, PB is better placed to negotiate with insurance companies. PB is focused on driving healthy growth, they said.Jefferies has a buy on Chalet Hotels with the target price at Rs 1,070. Analyst said that the company reaffirmed its metro dominance at its analyst meet, citing institutional partnerships, mixed-use expertise and industry-leading execution. The hospitality company is focused on ‘Big Box’ city assets and leisure properties, complemented by selective commercial real estate. Since listing, Chalet has added 1,050+ keys and has another 1,180 in the pipeline. The company prefers to balance brand tie-ups with a selective rollout of ATHIVA, its new upper-upscale brand tailored to each property’s potential.CLSA has an outperform rating on Hindalco with the target price raised to Rs 965.Analysts estimate that even at an LME price of $2,600 (spot $2,850), ongoing capacity and margin expansion initiatives could double earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) in the next five years, with significant free cash flow generation in the back half. They said in the near term, concerns at Novelis (capex escalation and fire in a plant) are likely to be offset by strong aluminium price outlook. The management was constructive on aluminium price outlook, they said. The company’s capacity addition in Indonesia (as China approaches its ceiling of 45 metric tonne) could face challenges on power availability. They also said that the demand is resilient.Citigroup has upgraded HDFC AM to neutral from sell with the target price raised to Rs 2,850. Analysts upgrade the stock on a number of factors. For one, the fund house shows sustained strength in performance across most key actively-managed high-yielding categories. It has an elevated focus on scaling up non-MF businesses. Also, there’s limited visibility of any near-term regulatory overhang. On the other hand, elevated competitive pressure and reducing distribution moats for incumbents remain the key concerns.Macquarie has an outperform rating on ITC with the target price at Rs 500. Analysts believe concerns on high per-stick taxes shared in draft excise document are misplaced, as such rates represent the cap and not the applicable rates. They see potential moderation in discounting post move to GST as a percentage of retail price, and moderation in leaf tobacco costs driving 10%+ FY27 EBIT growth in cigarette business. Analysts raised ITC’s earnings per share estimates and target price by 2% and 4%, respectively, to factor in these tailwinds. They also believe a re-rating needs clarity that cigarette tax will not increase materially post levy of a new cess.
Article Summary: Bofa securities has a neutral rating on pb fintech. Jefferies has a buy on chalet hotels with the target price at rs 1,070. Analysts believe concerns on high per-stick taxes shared in draft excise document are misplaced, as such rates represent the cap and not the applicable rates.

Article Title: US firm's 'we still sponsor H-1Bs' hoardings in India grab eyeballs amid $100,000 visa fee row
Article Text: A US-based AI recruitment firm came to IIT-Delhi for placement and assured the students that they will not hesitate to sponsor H-1Bs because of the $100,000 fee that the Donald Trump administration imposed, so that companies rely on American talent and don't import foreign skills. The firm's social media marketing also targeted the H-1B issue, the concerns over the high fees and established their message that the $100,000 fee will not stop them from hiring the best."We want to work in India for sure. But the exposure one gets abroad, in a diverse and fast-moving environment, is different. Strict visa rules are a big setback. So companies offering sponsorship is a huge thing for us," a student told news agency PTI.According to social media buzz, the AI company is San Francisco's Metaview, and the company's co-founder ran a similar campaign after the Trump administration announced the H-1B visa fee. Shahriar Tajbakhsh, the co-founder and CTO, said $100,000 is a rounding error compared to the value each member of the team creates. "If you're on an H-1B visa and your company doesn't value you enough to pay the $100k, check out to see if any of our roles might be a fit," he wrote."I'm seeing many companies from other countries using this as an opportunity to say, "come work in country X." That feels a bit desperate to me. Instead, come work with @MetaviewAI -- right here in San Francisco -- where $100K is a rounding error compared to the value each member of our team creates. Our team is ready to move fast and get to an offer/no-offer decision on any candidate within 24 hours of first contact. However, there's a catch. Candidates should spare 4-5 hours of their time for interviews," Tajbaksh wrote."Our company is looking to expand in the US, and we plan to submit more H-1B petitions in the next lottery. One executive order will not change my belief that an organization's success or failure is a function of its people," Tajbaksh told Business Insider, explaining his social media post. Tajbaksh came to the US through EB-1A visa which is an employment-based visa meant for those with extraordinary abilities in the sciences, arts, education, business or athletics.The H-1B row has again taken the centerstage after President Donald Trump said in a Fox interview that US needs certain talents from outside, riling up a section of MAGA who wants the H-1B program to be suspended.
Article Summary: Us-based ai recruitment firm came to iit-delhi for placement. Firm assured the students that they will not hesitate to sponsor h-1bs because of the $100,000 fee that the donald trump administration imposed. The firm's social media marketing also targeted the issue, the concerns over the high fees.

Article Title: Planning a longer stay in UAE? Here’s how to extend your UAE Visit Visa
Article Text:
UAE visit visas can be extended online or in person, with fees starting at AED 600/Representative Image

Who can extend a UAE Visit Visa?





How to apply for a UAE Visit Visa extension





1. Online extension

Log in to the ICP Smart Services Portal or mobile app using UAE Pass. Search for the Tourist Visa Extension or relevant service. Fill in your personal, travel, and passport details accurately. Upload required documents, including a copy of your passport and current visa. Pay the applicable fees securely online. Receive a confirmation email with an Application ID to track your application.

2. In person extension

Take an automated queue ticket and wait your turn. Submit your completed application with all required documents. Pay the service fee at the counter. If your visa was arranged through a sponsor or travel agency, they may submit the extension on your behalf.



UAE Visit Visa extension fees





Base visa extension fee: AED600

Value Added Tax (VAT): 5%

Additional processing fee (if applying inside the UAE): AED500

Knowledge Dirham fee: AED10 (supports educational projects)

Innovation Dirham fee: AED10 (supports innovation projects)

Overstaying your UAE Visit Visa





Key tips before applying





Ensure your passport is valid for at least six months.

Avoid last minute applications to prevent fines.

Always use an authorized visa service provider.

Confirm your visa type allows one or more extensions.

Seek advice early if you plan to switch to a residence or employment visa.





Disclaimer:

This article is intended for educational and informational purposes only. While every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of the information regarding UAE visit visa extensions in 2025, rules, fees, and procedures may change. Readers should always verify details with official UAE government portals or authorized service centers before taking any action. The author and publisher are not responsible for any errors, omissions, or consequences arising from the use of this information.





UAE has made it easier than ever for visitors to extend their stay with flexible visa policies and convenient online services. Whether you are in the UAE for tourism, business, family visits, or other purposes, understanding the visa extension rules, fees, and procedures is essential. This guide provides a clear, step-by-step overview to help you extend your UAE visit visa safely and legally.Not all visas are eligible for extensions, so it’s important to check your visa type first. Most visit visas, including those for tourism, attending a mission, exploring business opportunities, visiting a relative, medical treatment, studying, or training, allow extensions within the UAE.Residents of Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) countries can usually renew their visit visa once, subject to approval. The duration and terms of an extension depend on your visa type, the issuing authority, and how you entered the country.Important: Extensions must be applied for before your current visa expires. Dubai no longer offers a 10 day grace period, and overstaying results in fines of AED50 per day.You can apply for a visa extension without leaving the UAE. There are two main methods: online and in person.The online process is simple and convenient:You can also visit an Amer Centre or Customer Happiness Centre to extend your visa:The total cost of extending a UAE visit visa depends on where you apply and your visa type:Note: The final amount may vary depending on circumstances or visa category.Always confirm fees on the ICP portal or at an Amer Centre before applying.Overstaying carries strict penalties. For tourists, fines start immediately after the visa expires. There is no grace period.Residents with Golden or Green Visas, and their dependents, may stay up to 180 days after expiry. Other residents typically have a grace period of 30–60 days. All fines must be settled before applying for a new visa or leaving the UAE.
Article Summary: Uae visit visas can be extended online or in person, with fees starting at aed 600. Not all visas are eligible for extensions, so it’s important to check your visa type first. Most visit visas, including those for tourism, attending a mission, exploring business opportunities, visiting a relative, medical treatment, studying, or training, allow extensions within the uae.

Article Title: 'Sexploitation': 120K security cameras in South Korea hacked; 4 arrested for selling content
Article Text:
An AI-generated image





Four people have been arrested in South Korea for hacking more than 120,000 internet-connected surveillance cameras in homes and businesses and stealing footage to produce illegally filmed sexually exploitative content, the Washington Post reported citing officials.The Korean National Police Agency said the suspects operated independently and targeted a variety of IP cameras, including those in private homes, karaoke rooms, a pilates studio, and a gynaecologist’s clinic.Two of the suspects were responsible for more than 60% of the videos posted on an overseas-based website where the footage was sold. One suspect reportedly received around $24,000 in virtual assets for 545 videos, while another earned $12,000 for 648 videos. Another suspect allegedly hacked 70,000 cameras and sold 648 videos for 18 million won in virtual assets, the BBC reported.According to the NY Post, authorities have not disclosed the manufacturers of the hacked cameras. The website where the footage was sold, as well as those who viewed the videos, is also under investigation. Police have arrested three people suspected of purchasing or viewing the stolen material.One suspect is additionally charged with producing sexually exploitative content of children and adolescents, though police said this footage had been stored but not sold. All four are charged with hacking IP cameras, and two face further charges of selling illegally filmed sexual content.Authorities emphasised that weak passwords played a key role in the hack, with many cameras using simple or sequential combinations, making them vulnerable to cyberattacks. The National Police Agency urged all IP camera users to set complex, original passwords, update them regularly, and be cautious about using devices manufactured overseas, which may not meet local security standards.IP cameras, often used for monitoring children, pets, and businesses, have become popular globally due to their low cost but are increasingly targeted by hackers. Previous incidents include a 2019 US case in Mississippi where a man hacked a child’s Ring camera and harassed the child via the device’s two-way talk function, and a 2024 FTC fine on Verkada after footage from 150,000 cameras, including those in hospitals and schools, was stolen, reported The Washington Post.“Above all, it is crucial and effective for individual users who have installed IP cameras in homes or business premises to remain vigilant and immediately and regularly change their access passwords,” the BBC cited the National Police Agency as saying.According to the NY Post, South Korea has a long-standing problem with “molka,” or hidden cameras, which have been used to produce illegal sexual content in public spaces. Between 2011 and 2022, police made nearly 50,000 arrests related to illicit filming in hotels, pools, and public bathrooms. The widespread use of hidden cameras has also been a catalyst for the country’s feminist movement.Police have visited or notified victims at 58 locations, providing guidance on deleting footage and strengthening security. They are also cooperating with foreign authorities to investigate the website operator and users who accessed the stolen material. “IP camera hacking and illegal filming inflict immense suffering on victims and are therefore serious offences. We will eradicate them through vigorous investigations,” BBC quoted Park Woo-hyun, cyber investigation chief at the National Police Agency.
Article Summary: Four people have been arrested in south korea for hacking more than 120,000 internet-connected surveillance cameras in homes and businesses. Two of the suspects were responsible for more than 60% of the videos posted on an overseas-based website where the footage was sold.

Article Title: ‘Behavioural cocaine’: Australia defends social media ban for kids; no TikTok, Instagram for under-16s
Article Text:
AP file photo





Australia’s government on Wednesday justified its social media ban for under-16s, arguing it will protect young people from being pulled into an online “purgatory.”“With one law, we can protect Generation Alpha from being sucked into purgatory by the predatory algorithms described by the man who created the feature as behavioural cocaine,” communications minister Anika Wells said, as cited by AFP.Australia is set to impose a ban from December 10, preventing users under 16 from accessing a range of major social media platforms and websites, including Facebook, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube.The eSafety Commissioner must be satisfied that social media platforms have taken “reasonable steps” to prevent users under 16 from holding accounts, or they could face fines of up to $49.5 million. The government has said the list of affected platforms is dynamic, meaning other services could be added later if young users shift to them and similar risks arise.The commissioner has indicated that platforms like Lemon8 could be added to the list and would be required to remove accounts for under-16 users.Australian prime minister Anthony Albanese has described social media as “a platform for peer pressure, a driver of anxiety, a vehicle for scammers and, worst of all, a tool for online predators.”Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, declined to disclose how it plans to identify users it “understands” to be under 16, saying doing so could potentially alert teens on how to bypass the ban.Snapchat said it will use account behavioural signals along with the birth dates provided on user accounts to identify those believed to be under 16.TikTok stated it will adopt a “multi-layered approach to age assurance” using “various technologies and signals” to verify users’ ages, adding that it will share further details ahead of December 10, as cited by the Guardian.YouTube on Wednesday criticised the ban and described the world-first legislation as “rushed” and unrealistic."Most importantly, this law will not fulfil its promise to make kids safer online, and will, in fact, make Australian kids less safe on YouTube," YouTube public policy manager Rachel Lord stated, as cited by AFP.YouTube, one of the world’s most-visited websites, had initially been exempted from the ban so children could continue accessing educational content.However, in July, the Australian government reversed course, citing the need to protect young users from “predatory algorithms.”
Article Summary: Australia is set to impose a ban from december 10, preventing users under 16 from accessing a range of major social media platforms and websites. The government has said the list of affected platforms is dynamic, meaning other services could be added later if young users shift to them and similar risks arise.

Article Title: Oxford word of the year: It's ‘rage bait’ — here's what it means
Article Text: Rage bait has been crowned as the Word of the Year, 2025, by Oxford University Press. The phrase was chosen after a three-times surge was noted in its usage online, signaling "a deeper shift in how we talk about attention—both how it is given and how it is sought after—engagement, and ethics online. "The term is defined as “online content deliberately designed to elicit anger or outrage by being frustrating, provocative, or offensive, typically posted in order to increase traffic to or engagement with a particular web page or social media content”.The term triumphed aura farming and biohack, which were also shortlisted.The term rage bait first appeared on Usenet in 2002, where it referred to a specific kind of driver’s irritated reaction after being flashed by someone trying to overtake them—planting the seed for the idea of intentional provocation.Over time, the term shifted into online slang, used to describe viral posts on social media and to criticise the broader ecosystem of platforms, creators, and trends that shape what gets published and promoted online.It’s now a staple term in global journalism and in the vocabulary of online creators. The strategy works, too: outrage reliably boosts clicks, especially in the realm of performative politics.As social platforms increasingly reward inflammatory posts, the tactic has escalated into what’s known as rage-farming—a more systematic effort to cultivate anger and drive engagement by repeatedly planting rage-bait material, often wrapped in misinformation or conspiracy-fueled narratives.
Article Summary: Rage bait has been crowned as the word of the year, 2025, by oxford university press. The phrase was chosen after a three-times surge in its usage online. The term is defined as “online content deliberately designed to elicit anger or outrage by being frustrating, provocative, or offensive”
